lines.text:
[after a helicopter tasked with rescuing Burnett turns away after the mission of rescuing Burnett is canceled]
You've got to be shitting me!
We're not supposed to fly that sector, Chris. The brass will have a shit-fit.
Hey, we're on recon so let's recon something.
Let's go get our boy back!
You still got your boots, have you, cowboy?
Roger. They were tied on.

[talking to Burnett on the radio]
Burnett!
[pauses]

Zero-six, you've been shot down, life is tough. You're a combat aviator, start acting like one. Remember your training, put some angles between you and your pursuers. Evade and survive, and we will bring you home. You got that? We will bring you home.
Holy Shit! We're being painted!

[being chased by the S.A.M]
Chaff! Chaff! Chaff!
You dont know the FIRST thing about serving your country.
You're an optimist, sir. See I had you figured for a grouch.
I don't know you tell me sir?
Golden Nest, Archangel Zero-Six! We have been engaged!
We each have our jobs. Now I'm a Marine. That means I do the serious work. You're a Navy Pilot. That means that you sit here and... eat jello.

[Stackhouse is being interrogated after he is captured by Serb troops]
Are you alone?
Correct.
[the Serb troops, along with Lokar, leave and Stackhouse is watched by Sasha. Burnett observes from a nearby hill and sees Sasha execute Stackhouse]
[Yelling]
NO!
[Sasha looks at the hill where Burnett is. Knowing that he gave away his position, Burnett starts to run]

[Whistles to the nearby Serb troops and shouts in Serbian and begins shooting]
There's another one!

[In Serbian]
Fire on the hills!
[Serb troops begin firing on Burnett as he escapes]

[Burnett hands Reigart the evidence that contains the photos of the mass graves that Burnett and Stackhouse photographed]
This is why they killed Stackhouse!
It's not safe here. We keep moving.
No, you go. They killed my pilot because we took pictures of the graves, and I know where they are. And I am gonna get them, so he didn't die for no reason.
[Walks up to Babic and pats him on the back]
Don't follow me, it's safer here.
[Burnett leaves the area, and Babic walks off]

[In Serbian]
I have 48 hours, my friend. Let's see who can wait longer.

[Over the radio]
Archangel is down and I am on the run!

[Reigart makes his final decision on rescuing Burnett, despite doing so against orders]
You will lose your command for this.
So be it! I'm not gonna let that kid die out there while we sit around on this ship!
[Bazda accidentally steps on a mine as he and Sasha are looking for Burnett]
[to Sasha and speaking in Serbian]
Help me.

[Pulls out his pistol and aims at Bazda and speaks in Serbian]
Don't move. Be very still.

[as Sasha carefully walks off; speaking in Serbian]
Help me! HELP ME!
[Sasha shrugs at Bazda as Sasha leaves the area]

[to Burnett]
Unless we're parked in San Diego Bay, you're at war every time you step on this boat.
Everybody thinks they're gonna get a chance to punch some Nazi in the face in Normandy, but those days are over. They're long gone.
Our man is down behind enemy lines, now what the fuck is the problem?

[Yelling]
Do you have any idea how much damage this incident may cause to the peace process?
All I know, Admiral, is that the American people want their pilot back.

Exactly! Americans, all you care about is your own damn pilots! What happens when the fighting starts again? Will America recommit its forces to stop a major war? No, you don't have any control over that little detail, do you? You might have helped save your man today, Reigart, and I emphasize 'might', but you risk the lives of thousands tomorrow.

[Burnett learns that he and Stackhouse are being assigned to a reconnaissance mission over Bosnia]
Son of a bitch!
[Stackhouse comes up to Burnett]

[Referring to Admiral Reigart]
Did you see this? He put us on the holiday mission! God damn it!
Yeah, well look on the bright side, at least we get to fly, right?
Yeah, during the one good meal of the year, it's almost as if he doesn't like us.

[Jokingly]
No, you. Not me. You.
[Burnett arrives at the designated evacuation point]
[Over the radio]
Alpha Whiskey, this is Zero-Six, come in.

[Over the radio]
Zero-Six, go ahead.
Zero-Six is at rally point three and is standing by.
Zero-Six, latest intel says your current location undoable for pickup. Standby to copy rendezvous point.
Say again your last, I am at the rendezvous point.
You need to hump it out to safe zone. I set IP Cadillac, Canada 1-5, Virginia 2-0, for evac.

[Burnett looks at his map and realizes the newly designated extraction zone is miles away from his current position]
No. Negative, negative! I do not understand. Why is this spot not doable for pickup? I am good to go! I say again, I am good to go, NOW!

[On Bosnian grounds after being shot down]
You think they saw us eject?

[Pulling out his radio]
We're not gonna be round to find out. Reigart's gonna be really curious about what happened to his $40 million plane.

[Burnett and Stackhouse are having a discussion about a letter that Burnett wrote in which he expressed his interest of resigning from the Navy]
O'Malley told me you dropped your letter, he's bullshitting me, right?
Nope, he's telling the truth.
Oh, so you're gonna break up the band? That's good. Listen, Chris, I thought you were kidding about getting out. Are you telling me I gotta find another navigator? Is that the deal?
I can't do it anymore. I'm done, I'm sorry.
Where are we heading?
Hac.
Hac? That's good. Good.
[Next scene shows the truck the two men are aboard enter Hac, which is a war zone]
You should be glad you're not in the middle of a fight, Lieutenant. Because with your attitude, you wouldn't last very long.
Sir, with all due respect, I've given the Navy seven good years. I think I've served my country.

[to Reigart]
Sir, I signed up to be a fighter pilot. I didn't want to be a cop. And I certainly didn't want to go walking a beat on a neighborhood nobody cares about.
Admiral, what's going on down there?
We have an F18 shot down over southern Bosnia. One pilot is suspected dead.
Who authorized the search and rescue mission?
I did.
Call it off. Stand down, Admiral.
Maybe I didn't make myself clear! We have pilots down! One is probably already dead!
Admiral, I've spoken personally to Bosnian military commanders and they assure me the shoot down was perpetrated by renegades outside of their control, attempting to disrupt the peace process.
Well of course they're going to say that.
They're also claiming, Admiral, that your aircraft was way off mission.
Yes, well...
If we fly in there, we create a shitstorm, and the whole treaty will collapse.
Admiral, Burnett says that Serb troops murdered his pilot!
Is your pilot an expert on Bosnia? Can he tell the difference of the uniform of a Serb, Croat, and Muslim? Because I can't, and I've been posted here for five years.

[Bazda and Lokar are watching real life Serb General Ratko Mladic express his confidence in the Cincinnati Accords, which is aimed at keeping peace in Bosnia. All following characters are speaking in Serbian]
Coward. He placates these people, and why? Because they occupy our country?
He's a politician, Bazda.

[In English]
I welcome the announcement that NATO will leave the region.
He tells us to keep the Muslims at bay. Then he tells the world that we won't fire a shot.
We can't fight everyone at once. Think. Less emotion. You'll live longer.
Lokar's coming back here again, killing everyone.
It's true. Lokar killed everyone. Children and women. Buried them up in the hills.
In the hills? Yeah! I saw them, I saw the graves!
[Burnett has a flashback of the mass graves he encountered earlier]
Yes! I saw them! I saw the bodies in the hills. Tell them, I'm an American! I'm on your side!
[Last lines]

[Aboard the helicopter after the rescue mission]
Hey, Admiral! You're holding a letter for me. I'd like to have it back!
I think I can find it!

[Reigart hands Burnett the letter. Burnett then crumples the letter, which had stated his intent of leaving the Navy. The rest of the crew look on happily and amused. The song 'Rescue Blues' by Ryan Adams fades in]

[to Reigart over the radio]
Sir, I shouldn't have left Stackhouse.

[after hearing news reports alleging Burnett was killed]
Son of a bitch! They killed him and we did nothing! We did nothing!
Captain!

[Calmly]
We did nothing.
We're on another useless joyride at the cost of mere millions to the US taxpayer.
